body: LEAD: AFTER-CHRISTMAS REMEMBERED AFTER-CHRISTMAS REMEMBERED We popped from frozen doorways pushed away soft snow with fists cloved in new mittens puffed through woolen mufflers like diminutive dragons Hidden under homemade hats we gathered around a burning tree silver tinsels magically melted green needles turned to gray our toes and fingers felt
title: Metropolitan Diary

body: LEAD: UNADORNED homes are rare commodities around Christmastime in Bay Ridge, Bensonhurst and Canarsie. With thousands of plastic Santas and snowmen, armies of toy soldiers and multicolored megawatts of lights decorating block upon block of houses and apartment buildings, no one could accuse these Brooklyn neighborhoods of a lack of holiday cheer.
title: Neighborhoods Santa Has No Trouble Finding

body: LEAD: THE view from the back door of Pamela Keating's one-family home on 157th Street in Flushing, Queens, is of a big hole where two other single-family houses once stood. body: LEAD: Two masked gunmen robbed a Brooklyn bank of an undetermined amount of cash yesterday. The men announced the holdup at 6:17 P.M. after the Williamsburg Savings Bank at 2301 81st St. in Bensonhurst had closed for the day, said a police spokesman, Sgt. Raymond O'Donnell.
